  35_instantiation_paths = {}
  36
  37
  38class _InstantiationTrackerMixin:
  39    """Mixin class to track where a component was instantiated."""
  40
  41    def __init__(self):
  42        name = type(self).__name__
  43        if name not in _instantiation_paths:
  44            # Get the first relevant frame outside of this class
  45            for frame_info in inspect.stack():
  46                filename = frame_info.filename
  47                if "site-packages" in filename or filename == __file__:
  48                    continue
  49                self._instantiation_path = Path(filename).resolve()
  50                _instantiation_paths[name] = self._instantiation_path
  51                break
  52        else:
  53            # If already instantiated, use the existing path
  54            self._instantiation_path = _instantiation_paths[name]
  55
  56    @property
  57    def instantiation_dir(self) -> Path:
  58        """Return directory of the file that instantiated the component, if it's a Component type or a Device subtype, otherwise the location the module is defined"""
  59        if self is type(Component) or isinstance(self, Device):
  60            return self._instantiation_path.parent
  61
  62        # Fallback: use where the class is defined
  63        module_name = self.__class__.__module__
  64        module = sys.modules.get(module_name) or importlib.import_module(module_name)
  65        path = Path(module.__file__).resolve()
  66        return path.parent
  67
  68    @property
  69    def instantiating_file_stem(self) -> str:
  70        """Return filename_stem of the file that instantiated the component, if it's a Component type or a Device subtype, otherwise the location the module is defined"""
  71        from . import Device, Component
  72
  73        if self is type(Component) or isinstance(self, Device):
  74            return self._instantiation_path.stem
  75
  76        # Fallback: use where the class is defined
  77        module_name = self.__class__.__module__
  78        module = sys.modules.get(module_name) or importlib.import_module(module_name)
  79        path = Path(module.__file__).resolve()
  80        return path.stem

  83class Port(_InstantiationTrackerMixin):
  84    """
  85    ###### Class representing a port in a microfluidic device.
  86    ###### Ports are used to connect components and define their interaction with the environment.
  87    ###### Each port has a type (IN, OUT, INOUT), a position in 3D space, a size, and a surface normal.
  88    ###### The surface normal defines the direction in which the port is oriented.
  89    """
  90
  91    class PortType(Enum):
  92        """Enumeration for port types."""
  93
  94        IN = 1
  95        OUT = 2
  96        INOUT = 3
  97
  98    class SurfaceNormal(Enum):
  99        """Enumeration for surface normals."""
 100
 101        POS_X = 1
 102        POS_Y = 2
 103        POS_Z = 3
 104        NEG_X = 4
 105        NEG_Y = 5
 106        NEG_Z = 6
 107
 108    _vector_map = {
 109        SurfaceNormal.POS_X: (1, 0, 0),
 110        SurfaceNormal.POS_Y: (0, 1, 0),
 111        SurfaceNormal.POS_Z: (0, 0, 1),
 112        SurfaceNormal.NEG_X: (-1, 0, 0),
 113        SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y: (0, -1, 0),
 114        SurfaceNormal.NEG_Z: (0, 0, -1),
 115    }
 116
 117    def __init__(
 118        self,
 119        _type: PortType,
 120        position: tuple[int, int, int],
 121        size: tuple[int, int, int],
 122        surface_normal: SurfaceNormal,
 123    ):
 124        """
 125        ###### Initialize a port.
 126
 127        ###### Parameters:
 128        - _type (PortType): The type of the port (IN, OUT, INOUT).
 129        - position (tuple[int, int, int]): The position of the port in 3D space.
 130        - size (tuple[int, int, int]): The size of the port.
 131        - surface_normal (SurfaceNormal): The surface normal of the port, defining its orientation.
 132        """
 133        super().__init__()
 134        self._parent = None
 135        self._name = None
 136        self._type = _type
 137        self._position = position
 138        self._size = size
 139        self._surface_normal = surface_normal
 140
 141    def copy(self) -> "Port":
 142        """Create a copy of the port."""
 143        p = Port(
 144            self._type,
 145            self._position,
 146            self._size,
 147            self._surface_normal,
 148        )
 149        p._parent = self._parent
 150        p._name = self._name
 151        return p
 152
 153    def get_name(self) -> str:
 154        """Get the name of the port, including parent name."""
 155        if self._name is None:
 156            raise ValueError(f"Port has not been named")
 157        else:
 158            return f"{self._parent._name}_{self._name}"
 159
 160    def get_fully_qualified_name(self) -> str:
 161        """Get the fully qualified name of the port, including all parent components names."""
 162        if self._name is None:
 163            raise ValueError(f"Port has not been named")
 164        name = self._name
 165        parent = self._parent
 166        while parent is not None:
 167            if parent._name is not None:
 168                name = f"{parent._name}.{name}"
 169                parent = parent._parent
 170            else:
 171                name = f"{parent.instantiating_file_stem}.{name}"
 172                return name
 173        return name
 174
 175    def to_vector(self) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
 176        """Convert the surface normal to a vector."""
 177        try:
 178            return self._vector_map[self._surface_normal]
 179        except KeyError:
 180            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported surface normal: {self._surface_normal}")
 181
 182    def get_bounding_box(
 183        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 184    ) -> tuple[int, int, int, int, int, int]:
 185        """
 186        Get the bounding box of the port.
 187        The bounding box is defined by the position and size of the port,
 188        adjusted based on the surface normal direction.
 189
 190        Parameters:
 191        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 192        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 193
 194        Returns:
 195        - A tuple of six integers representing the bounding box coordinates:
 196        (min_x, min_y, min_z, max_x, max_y, max_z)
 197        """
 198        dx, dy, dz = self._vector_map[self._surface_normal]
 199        pos = list(self._position)
 200        size = self._size
 201
 202        # For negative directions, shift start back by size
 203        if dx < 0:
 204            pos[0] -= size[0]
 205        if dy < 0:
 206            pos[1] -= size[1]
 207        if dz < 0:
 208            pos[2] -= size[2]
 209
 210        _px_size = self._parent._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 211        _layer_size = self._parent._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 212
 213        return (
 214            pos[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 215            pos[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 216            pos[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
 217            pos[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size
 218            + size[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 219            pos[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size
 220            + size[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 221            pos[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size
 222            + size[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
 223        )
 224
 225    def get_origin(self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None):
 226        """
 227        Get the origin of the port, which is the minimum corner of its bounding box.
 228
 229        Parameters:
 230        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 231        """
 232        return self.get_bounding_box(px_size, layer_size)[0:3]
 233
 234    def get_position(
 235        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 236    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
 237        """
 238        Get the position of the port in 3D space.
 239
 240        Parameters:
 241        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 242        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 243
 244        Returns:
 245        - A tuple of three integers representing the position of the port (x, y, z).
 246        """
 247
 248        _px_size = self._parent._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 249        _layer_size = self._parent._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 250        return (
 251            self._position[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 252            self._position[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 253            self._position[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
 254        )
 255
 256    def get_size(
 257        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 258    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
 259        """
 260        Get the size of the port.
 261
 262        Parameters:
 263        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 264
 265        Returns:
 266        - A tuple of three integers representing the size of the port (width, height, depth).
 267        """
 268        _px_size = self._parent._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 269        _layer_size = self._parent._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 270        return (
 271            self._size[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 272            self._size[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
 273            self._size[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
 274        )
 275
 276    def get_color(self):
 277        """
 278        ###### Get the color of the port based on its type.
 279
 280        ###### The color is determined as follows:
 281        - IN ports are green
 282        - OUT ports are red
 283        - INOUT ports are blue
 284        - If the type is not recognized, it defaults to white.
 285
 286        ###### Returns:
 287        - Color: The color of the port.
 288        """
 289        if self._type == Port.PortType.IN:
 290            return Color.from_name("green", 255)  # Green
 291        elif self._type == Port.PortType.OUT:
 292            return Color.from_name("red", 255)  # Red
 293        elif self._type == Port.PortType.INOUT:
 294            return Color.from_name("blue", 255)  # Blue
 295        else:
 296            return Color.from_name("white", 255)  # White
 297

 299class Component(_InstantiationTrackerMixin):
 300    """
 301    ###### Base class for components in a microfluidic device.
 302    ###### Components can contain shapes, ports, subcomponents, and labels.
 303    ###### Each component has a size, position, pixel size, and layer size.
 304    ###### Components can be translated, rotated, mirrored, and rendered.
 305    """
 306
 307    def __init__(
 308        self,
 309        size: tuple[int, int, int],
 310        position: tuple[int, int, int],
 311        px_size: float = 0.0076,
 312        layer_size: float = 0.01,
 313    ):
 314        """
 315        ###### Parameters:
 316        - size (tuple[int, int, int]): The size of the component in pixels (width, height, depth).
 317        - position (tuple[int, int, int]): The position of the component in 3D space (x, y, z).
 318        - px_size (float): The size of a pixel in mm. Default is 0.0076 m.
 319        - layer_size (float): The size of a layer in mm. Default is 0.01 m.
 320        """
 321        super().__init__()
 322        self._parent = None
 323        self._name = None
 324        self._position = position
 325        self._size = size
 326        self._px_size = px_size
 327        self._layer_size = layer_size
 328        self._translations = [0, 0, 0]
 329        self._rotation = 0
 330        self._mirroring = [False, False]
 331        self.shapes = {}
 332        self.bulk_shapes = {}
 333        self.ports = {}
 334        self.connected_ports = []
 335        self.subcomponents = {}
 336        self.default_exposure_settings = None
 337        self.default_position_settings = None
 338        self.regional_settings = {}
 339        self.burnin_settings = []
 340        self.labels = {}
 341
 342    def __eq__(self, other):
 343        """
 344        ###### Check if two components are equivilant based on their attribute.
 345        ###### We only need to compare the instantiated attributes, the rotation, and mirroring.
 346        """
 347        if not isinstance(other, Component):
 348            return False
 349        if not type(self) == type(other):
 350            return False
 351        if self._rotation != other._rotation:
 352            return False
 353        if self._mirroring != other._mirroring:
 354            return False
 355        if len(self.init_args) != len(other.init_args):
 356            return False
 357        for i, arg in enumerate(self.init_args):
 358            if arg != other.init_args[i]:
 359                return False
 360        if len(self.init_kwargs) != len(other.init_kwargs):
 361            return False
 362        for k, v in self.init_kwargs.items():
 363            if k not in other.init_kwargs or v != other.init_kwargs[k]:
 364                return False
 365        return True
 366
 367    def __getattr__(self, name):
 368        """
 369        ###### Custom attribute lookup for Component.
 370        ###### This method is called when an attribute is not found in the usual places.
 371        ###### It allows accessing ports by their names."""
 372        if name in self.ports:
 373            return self.ports[name]
 374        raise AttributeError(f"'{type(self).__name__}' object has no attribute '{name}'")
 375
 376    def get_fully_qualified_name(self):
 377        """Get the fully qualified name of the component, including all parent components names."""
 378        if self._name is None:
 379            raise ValueError(f"Component has not been named")
 380        name = self._name
 381        parent = self._parent
 382        while parent is not None:
 383            if parent._name is not None:
 384                name = f"{parent._name}.{name}"
 385                parent = parent._parent
 386            else:
 387                name = f"{parent.instantiating_file_stem}.{name}"
 388                return name
 389        return name
 390
 391    def get_bounding_box(
 392        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 393    ) -> tuple[int, int, int, int, int, int]:
 394        """
 395        Get the bounding box of the component.
 396        The bounding box is defined by the position and size of the component.
 397
 398        Parameters:
 399        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 400        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 401
 402        Returns:
 403        - A tuple of six integers representing the bounding box coordinates:
 404        """
 405        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 406        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 407
 408        # if self._rotation % 180 != 0:
 409        #     min_x = self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 410        #     max_x = (
 411        #         self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 412        #         + self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 413        #     )
 414        #     min_y = self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 415        #     max_y = (
 416        #         self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 417        #         + self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 418        #     )
 419        #     min_z = self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 420        #     max_z = (
 421        #         self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 422        #         + self._size[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 423        #     )
 424        # else:
 425        min_x = self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 426        max_x = (
 427            self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 428            + self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 429        )
 430        min_y = self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 431        max_y = (
 432            self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 433            + self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 434        )
 435        min_z = self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 436        max_z = (
 437            self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 438            + self._size[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 439        )
 440        return (min_x, min_y, min_z, max_x, max_y, max_z)
 441
 442    def get_size(
 443        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 444    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
 445        """
 446        Get the size of the component.
 447
 448        Parameters:
 449        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 450        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 451
 452        Returns:
 453        - A tuple of three integers representing the size of the component (width, height, depth).
 454        """
 455        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 456        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 457        return (
 458            self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 459            self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 460            self._size[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size,
 461        )
 462
 463    def get_position(
 464        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 465    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
 466        """
 467        Get the position of the component in 3D space.
 468
 469        Parameters:
 470        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 471        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 472
 473        Returns:
 474        - A tuple of three integers representing the position of the component (x, y, z).
 475        """
 476        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 477        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 478        return (
 479            self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 480            self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 481            self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size,
 482        )
 483
 484    def _validate_name(self, name):
 485        """
 486        ###### Validate the name for a new port.
 487        ###### Raises:
 488        - ValueError: If the name already exists in the component or is not a valid Python identifier.
 489        """
 490        for p in self.ports.keys():
 491            if p == name:
 492                raise ValueError(
 493                    f"Port with name '{name}' already exists in component {self._name}"
 494                )
 495        if not name.isidentifier():
 496            raise ValueError(
 497                f"Name '{name}' is not a valid Python identifier (e.g. no spaces, starts with letter, etc.)"
 498            )
 499        if hasattr(self, name):
 500            raise ValueError(f"Name '{name}' conflicts with existing attributes")
 501
 502    def add_label(self, name: str, color: Color):
 503        """
 504        ###### Add a label to the component.
 505        ###### Parameters:
 506        - name (str): The name of the label (must be a unique python identifier).
 507        - color (Color): The color of the label, which can be a Color object or a tuple of RGBA values.
 508        """
 509        self._validate_name(name)
 510        self.labels[name] = color
 511
 512    def add_shape(self, name: str, shape: Shape, label: str):
 513        """
 514        ###### Add a shape to the component.
 515        ###### Parameters:
 516        - name (str): The name of the shape (must be a unique python identifier).
 517        - shape (Shape): The shape to be added.
 518        - label (str): The label for the shape, which should be a key in the component's labels dictionary.
 519        """
 520        self._validate_name(name)
 521        shape._name = name
 522        shape._parent = self
 523        shape._color = self.labels[label]
 524        self.shapes[name] = shape
 525
 526    def add_bulk_shape(self, name: str, shape: Shape, label: str):
 527        """
 528        ###### Add a bulk shape to the component.
 529        ###### Parameters:
 530        - name (str): The name of the bulk shape (must be a unique python identifier).
 531        - shape (Shape): The bulk shape to be added.
 532        - label (str): The label for the bulk shape, which should be a key in the component's labels dictionary.
 533        """
 534        self._validate_name(name)
 535        shape._name = name
 536        shape._parent = self
 537        shape._color = self.labels[label]
 538        self.bulk_shapes[name] = shape
 539
 540    def add_port(self, name: str, port: Port):
 541        """
 542        ###### Add a port to the component.
 543        ###### Parameters:
 544        - name (str): The name of the port (must be a unique python identifier).
 545        - port (Port): The port to be added.
 546        """
 547        self._validate_name(name)
 548        port._name = name
 549        port._parent = self
 550        self.ports[name] = port
 551
 552    def add_subcomponent(self, name: str, component: Component):
 553        """
 554        ###### Add a subcomponent to the component.
 555        ###### Parameters:
 556        - name (str): The name of the subcomponent (must be a unique python identifier).
 557        - component (Component): The subcomponent to be added.
 558        """
 559        self._validate_name(name)
 560        component._name = name
 561        component._parent = self
 562        component.run_translate()
 563        self.subcomponents[name] = component
 564
 565        for label, color in component.labels.items():
 566            self.labels[f"{name}.{label}"] = color
 567
 568    def add_default_exposure_settings(
 569        self,
 570        settings: ExposureSettings,
 571    ):
 572        """
 573        ###### Add default exposure settings to the component.
 574        ###### Parameters:
 575        - settings (ExposureSettings): The exposure settings to be added.
 576        """
 577        self.default_exposure_settings = settings
 578
 579    def add_default_position_settings(
 580        self,
 581        settings: PositionSettings,
 582    ):
 583        """
 584        ###### Add default position settings to the component.
 585        ###### Parameters:
 586        - settings (PositionSettings): The position settings to be added.
 587        """
 588        self.default_position_settings = settings
 589
 590    def add_regional_settings(
 591        self,
 592        name: str,
 593        shape: Shape,
 594        settings: Union[
 595            PositionSettings,
 596            ExposureSettings,
 597            MembraneSettings,
 598            SecondaryDoseSettings,
 599        ],
 600        label: str,
 601    ):
 602        """
 603        ###### Add regional settings in a given shape to the component.
 604        ###### Parameters:
 605        - name (str): The name of the regional settings (must be a unique python identifier).
 606        - shape (Shape): The shape to which the regional settings apply.
 607        - settings (Union[PositionSettings, ExposureSettings, MembraneSettings, SecondaryDoseSettings]): The settings to be applied in the shape.
 608        - label (str): The label for the regional settings, which should be a key in the component's labels dictionary.
 609        """
 610        self._validate_name(name)
 611        shape._name = name
 612        shape._parent = self
 613        shape._color = self.labels[label]
 614
 615        # check for collisions with other settings
 616        for existing_name, (
 617            existing_shape,
 618            existing_settings,
 619        ) in self.regional_settings.items():
 620            if (
 621                type(settings) == type(existing_settings)
 622                and not (existing_shape.copy() & shape.copy())._object.is_empty()
 623            ):
 624                raise ValueError(
 625                    f"Regional settings '{name}' collides with existing settings '{existing_name}' in component {self._name}"
 626                )
 627
 628        self.regional_settings[name] = (shape, settings)
 629
 630    def set_burn_in_exposure(self, exposure_times: list[float]):
 631        """
 632        ###### Set burn-in exposure times for the component.
 633        ###### Parameters:
 634        - exposure_times (list[float]): List of exposure times in seconds for the burn-in process.
 635        """
 636        self.burnin_settings = exposure_times
 637
 638    def relabel_subcomponents(self, subcomponents: list[Component], label: str):
 639        """
 640        ###### Relabel listed subcomponents with a new label.
 641        ###### Parameters:
 642        - subcomponents (list[Component]): List of subcomponents to relabel.
 643        - label (str): The new label to apply to the subcomponents.
 644        """
 645        for c in subcomponents:
 646            c.relabel_labels(c.labels.keys(), label, self.labels[label])
 647
 648    def relabel_labels(self, labels: list[str], label: str, _color: Color = None):
 649        """
 650        ###### Relabel subcomponent labels with a new label and color.
 651        ###### Parameters:
 652        - labels (list[str]): List of labels to relabel.
 653        - label (str): The new label to apply.
 654        - _color (Color, optional): The color to apply to the labels. If None, uses the color of the specified label. (internal use only)
 655        """
 656        if _color is None:
 657            _color = self.labels[label]
 658        for l, c in self.labels.items():
 659            if l in labels:
 660                c._change_to_color(_color)
 661        for c in self.subcomponents.values():
 662            c.relabel_labels(labels, label, _color)
 663
 664    def relabel_shapes(self, shapes: list[Shape], label: str):
 665        """
 666        ###### Relabel shapes with a new label.
 667        ###### Parameters:
 668        - shapes (list[Shape]): List of shapes to relabel.
 669        - label (str): The new label to apply to the shapes.
 670        """
 671        for s in shapes:
 672            s._color = self.labels[label]
 673
 674    def connect_port(self, port: Port):
 675        """
 676        ###### Label port as connected.
 677        ###### Parameters:
 678        - port (Port): Port to connect.
 679        """
 680        if port not in self.connected_ports:
 681            self.connected_ports.append(port)

 830    def translate(
 831        self, translation: tuple[int, int, int], _internal: bool = False
 832    ) -> Component:
 833        """
 834        ###### Translate the component by a given translation vector.
 835        ###### Parameters:
 836        - translation (tuple[int, int, int]): The translation vector in parent pixels/layers (dx, dy, dz) to apply to the component.
 837        - _internal (bool): If True, the translation uses the component's pixels/layers for internal calculations and opperates immediatly. Default is False.
 838        ###### Returns:
 839        - self: The translated component.
 840        """
 841        if self._parent is None and not _internal:
 842            self._translations[0] += translation[0]
 843            self._translations[1] += translation[1]
 844            self._translations[2] += translation[2]
 845        else:
 846            if not _internal:
 847                translation = (
 848                    round(translation[0] / self._px_size * self._parent._px_size),
 849                    round(translation[1] / self._px_size * self._parent._px_size),
 850                    round(translation[2] / self._layer_size * self._parent._layer_size),
 851                )
 852            for component in self.subcomponents.values():
 853                component.translate(translation)
 854            for shape in self.shapes.values():
 855                shape.translate(translation)
 856            for bulk_shape in self.bulk_shapes.values():
 857                bulk_shape.translate(translation)
 858            for shape, _ in self.regional_settings.values():
 859                shape.translate(translation)
 860            for port in self.ports.values():
 861                port._position = (
 862                    port._position[0] + translation[0],
 863                    port._position[1] + translation[1],
 864                    port._position[2] + translation[2],
 865                )
 866            if not _internal:
 867                self._position = (
 868                    self._position[0] + translation[0],
 869                    self._position[1] + translation[1],
 870                    self._position[2] + translation[2],
 871                )
 872        return self
 873
 874    def run_translate(self) -> Component:
 875        translation = (
 876            round(self._translations[0] / self._px_size * self._parent._px_size),
 877            round(self._translations[1] / self._px_size * self._parent._px_size),
 878            round(self._translations[2] / self._layer_size * self._parent._layer_size),
 879        )
 880
 881        for component in self.subcomponents.values():
 882            component.translate(translation)
 883        for shape in self.shapes.values():
 884            shape.translate(translation)
 885        for bulk_shape in self.bulk_shapes.values():
 886            bulk_shape.translate(translation)
 887        for shape, _ in self.regional_settings.values():
 888            shape.translate(translation)
 889        for port in self.ports.values():
 890            port._position = (
 891                port._position[0] + translation[0],
 892                port._position[1] + translation[1],
 893                port._position[2] + translation[2],
 894            )
 895        # if set_origin:
 896        self._position = (
 897            self._position[0] + translation[0],
 898            self._position[1] + translation[1],
 899            self._position[2] + translation[2],
 900        )
 901
 902    def rotate(self, rotation: int, in_place: bool = False) -> Component:
 903        """
 904        ###### Rotate the component around the Z axis by a given angle.
 905        ###### Parameters:
 906        - rotation (int): The angle in degrees to rotate the component. Must be a multiple of 90.
 907        - in_place (bool): If True, the component is rotated in place. Default is False.
 908        ###### Returns:
 909        - self: The rotated component.
 910        """
 911        if rotation % 90 != 0:
 912            raise ValueError("Rotation must be a multiple of 90 degrees")
 913
 914        self._rotation = (self._rotation + rotation) % 360
 915
 916        if in_place:
 917            original_position = self._position
 918            # Translate the component to position for in-place rotation
 919            self.translate(
 920                (-self._position[0], -self._position[1], -self._position[2]),
 921                _internal=True,
 922            )
 923
 924        for component in self.subcomponents.values():
 925            component.rotate(rotation)
 926
 927        for shape in self.shapes.values():
 928            shape.rotate((0, 0, rotation))
 929
 930        for bulk_shape in self.bulk_shapes.values():
 931            bulk_shape.rotate((0, 0, rotation))
 932
 933        for shape, _ in self.regional_settings.values():
 934            shape.rotate((0, 0, rotation))
 935
 936        rot = rotation % 360
 937
 938        # Mapping for 90-degree rotation steps around Z axis
 939        vector_rotation_map = {
 940            90: {
 941                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X: (Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y, (-1, 0)),
 942                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y: (Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X, (0, 0)),
 943                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X: (Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y, (-1, 0)),
 944                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y: (Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X, (0, 0)),
 945            },
 946            180: {
 947                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X: (Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X, (0, -1)),
 948                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y: (Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y, (-1, 0)),
 949                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X: (Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X, (0, -1)),
 950                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y: (Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y, (-1, 0)),
 951            },
 952            270: {
 953                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X: (Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y, (0, 0)),
 954                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y: (Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X, (0, -1)),
 955                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X: (Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y, (0, 0)),
 956                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y: (Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X, (0, -1)),
 957            },
 958        }
 959
 960        for port in self.ports.values():
 961            x, y, z = port._position
 962
 963            if rot == 90:
 964                port._position = (-y, x, z)
 965            elif rot == 180:
 966                port._position = (-x, -y, z)
 967            elif rot == 270:
 968                port._position = (y, -x, z)
 969
 970            if port._surface_normal in vector_rotation_map.get(rot, {}):
 971                new_vector, (dx, dy) = vector_rotation_map[rot][port._surface_normal]
 972                port._position = (
 973                    port._position[0] + dx * port._size[0],
 974                    port._position[1] + dy * port._size[1],
 975                    port._position[2],
 976                )
 977                port._surface_normal = new_vector
 978
 979            # Adjust Z ports if needed
 980            if port._surface_normal in (
 981                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Z,
 982                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Z,
 983            ):
 984                if rot == 90:
 985                    port._position = (
 986                        port._position[0] - port._size[0],
 987                        port._position[1],
 988                        port._position[2],
 989                    )
 990                elif rot == 180:
 991                    port._position = (
 992                        port._position[0] - port._size[0],
 993                        port._position[1] - port._size[1],
 994                        port._position[2],
 995                    )
 996                elif rot == 270:
 997                    port._position = (
 998                        port._position[0],
 999                        port._position[1] - port._size[1],
1000                        port._position[2],
1001                    )
1002
1003        if in_place:
1004            # Translate the component so new negative-negative corner is at original position
1005            if rot == 90:
1006                self.translate(
1007                    (
1008                        original_position[0] + self._size[1],
1009                        original_position[1],
1010                        original_position[2],
1011                    ),
1012                    _internal=True,
1013                )
1014            elif rot == 180:
1015                self.translate(
1016                    (
1017                        original_position[0] + self._size[0],
1018                        original_position[1] + self._size[1],
1019                        original_position[2],
1020                    ),
1021                    _internal=True,
1022                )
1023            elif rot == 270:
1024                self.translate(
1025                    (
1026                        original_position[0],
1027                        original_position[1] + self._size[0],
1028                        original_position[2],
1029                    ),
1030                    _internal=True,
1031                )
1032
1033            if rot in (90, 270):
1034                self._size = (self._size[1], self._size[0], self._size[2])
1035        else:
1036            # Update position and size for non in-place rotation (position is negative-negative corner)
1037            if rot == 90:
1038                self._position = (
1039                    self._position[0] - self._size[1],
1040                    self._position[1],
1041                    self._position[2],
1042                )
1043            elif rot == 180:
1044                self._position = (
1045                    self._position[0] - self._size[0],
1046                    self._position[1] - self._size[1],
1047                    self._position[2],
1048                )
1049            elif rot == 270:
1050                self._position = (
1051                    self._position[0],
1052                    self._position[1] - self._size[0],
1053                    self._position[2],
1054                )
1055
1056            if rot in (90, 270):
1057                self._size = (self._size[1], self._size[0], self._size[2])
1058        return self
1059
1060    def mirror(
1061        self, mirror_x: bool = False, mirror_y: bool = False, in_place: bool = False
1062    ) -> Component:
1063        """
1064        ###### Mirror the component along the X and/or Y axes.
1065        ###### Parameters:
1066        - mirror_x (bool): If True, mirrors the component along the X axis. Default is False.
1067        - mirror_y (bool): If True, mirrors the component along the Y axis. Default is False.
1068        - in_place (bool): If True, performs the mirroring in place. Default is False.
1069        ###### Returns:
1070        - self: The mirrored component.
1071        """
1072        if not mirror_x and not mirror_y:
1073            return self  # No mirroring requested
1074
1075        if mirror_x and mirror_y:
1076            return self.rotate(180, in_place=in_place)
1077
1078        self._mirroring = [mirror_x ^ self._mirroring[0], mirror_y ^ self._mirroring[1]]
1079
1080        if in_place:
1081            original_position = self._position
1082            # Translate the component to position for in-place mirroring
1083            self.translate(
1084                (-self._position[0], -self._position[1], -self._position[2]),
1085                _internal=True,
1086            )
1087
1088        for component in self.subcomponents.values():
1089            component.mirror(mirror_x, mirror_y)
1090
1091        for shape in self.shapes.values():
1092            shape.mirror((mirror_x, mirror_y, False))
1093
1094        for bulk_shape in self.bulk_shapes.values():
1095            bulk_shape.mirror((mirror_x, mirror_y, False))
1096
1097        for shape, _ in self.regional_settings.values():
1098            shape.mirror((mirror_x, mirror_y, False))
1099
1100        # Surface normal flips
1101        mirror_vector_map = {
1102            "x": {
1103                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X: Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X,
1104                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X: Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X,
1105            },
1106            "y": {
1107                Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y: Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y,
1108                Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y: Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y,
1109            },
1110        }
1111
1112        for port in self.ports.values():
1113            x, y, z = port._position
1114            sx, sy = port._size[0], port._size[1]
1115
1116            if mirror_x:
1117                x = -x - sx
1118                # If pointing in +X or -X, correct for sticking out
1119                if port._surface_normal == Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_X:
1120                    x += sx
1121                elif port._surface_normal == Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_X:
1122                    x += sx
1123                port._surface_normal = mirror_vector_map["x"].get(
1124                    port._surface_normal, port._surface_normal
1125                )
1126
1127            if mirror_y:
1128                y = -y - sy
1129                # If pointing in +Y or -Y, correct for sticking out
1130                if port._surface_normal == Port.SurfaceNormal.POS_Y:
1131                    y += sy
1132                elif port._surface_normal == Port.SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y:
1133                    y += sy
1134                port._surface_normal = mirror_vector_map["y"].get(
1135                    port._surface_normal, port._surface_normal
1136                )
1137
1138            port._position = (x, y, z)
1139
1140        if in_place:
1141            # Translate the component so new negative-negative corner is at original position
1142            if mirror_x and not mirror_y:
1143                self.translate(
1144                    (
1145                        original_position[0] + self._size[0],
1146                        original_position[1],
1147                        original_position[2],
1148                    ),
1149                    _internal=True,
1150                )
1151            elif not mirror_x and mirror_y:
1152                self.translate(
1153                    (
1154                        original_position[0],
1155                        original_position[1] + self._size[1],
1156                        original_position[2],
1157                    ),
1158                    _internal=True,
1159                )
1160        else:
1161            # Update position for non in-place mirroring (position is negative-negative corner)
1162            if mirror_x and not mirror_y:
1163                self._position = (
1164                    self._position[0] - self._size[0],
1165                    self._position[1],
1166                    self._position[2],
1167                )
1168            elif not mirror_x and mirror_y:
1169                self._position = (
1170                    self._position[0],
1171                    self._position[1] - self._size[1],
1172                    self._position[2],
1173                )
1174
1175        return self
1176
1177    def render(self, filename: str = "component.glb", do_bulk_difference: bool = True):
1178        """
1179        ###### Render the component to a GLB file.
1180        ###### Parameters:
1181        - filename (str): The name of the output GLB file. Default is "component.glb".
1182        - do_bulk_difference (bool): If True, applies a difference operation for bulk shapes. Default is True.
1183        ###### Returns:
1184        - None: The rendered scene is exported to the specified file.
1185        """
1186        print("Rendering Component...")
1187        scene = render_component(
1188            component=self,
1189            render_bulk=True,
1190            do_bulk_difference=do_bulk_difference,
1191            flatten_scene=True,
1192            wireframe_bulk=False,
1193            show_assists=False,
1194        )
1195        print("Exporting rendering...")
1196        scene.export(filename)
1197
1198    def preview(
1199        self,
1200        filename: str = "pymfd/viewer/component.glb",
1201        render_bulk: bool = False,
1202        do_bulk_difference: bool = False,
1203        wireframe: bool = False,
1204    ):
1205        """
1206        ###### Preview the component in a GLB file.
1207        ###### Parameters:
1208        - filename (str): The name of the output GLB file. Default is "pymfd/viewer/component.glb".
1209        - render_bulk (bool): If True, renders bulk shapes. Default is False.
1210        - do_bulk_difference (bool): If True, applies a difference operation for bulk shapes. Default is False.
1211        - wireframe (bool): If True, renders the scene in wireframe mode. Default is False.
1212        ###### Returns:

1222            show_assists=True,
1223        )

1256from math import gcd
1257from functools import reduce
1258from fractions import Fraction
1259
1260
1261def float_gcf(numbers, max_denominator=10**6):
1262    if not numbers:
1263        raise ValueError("Input list must not be empty")
1264
1265    # Convert all floats to Fractions
1266    fracs = [Fraction(x).limit_denominator(max_denominator) for x in numbers]
1267
1268    # Get least common multiple (LCM) of all denominators
1269    def lcm(a, b):
1270        return abs(a * b) // gcd(a, b)
1271
1272    common_den = reduce(lcm, (f.denominator for f in fracs))
1273
1274    # Convert all to integers with common denominator
1275    int_values = [int(f * common_den) for f in fracs]
1276
1277    # Compute GCF of these integers
1278    result = reduce(gcd, int_values)
1279
1280    # Convert back to float
1281    return result / common_den
1282
1283
1284class VariableLayerThicknessComponent(Component):
1285    """
1286    A component with variable layer thickness, allowing for different layer sizes at each height.
1287    """
1288
1289    def __init__(
1290        self,
1291        size: tuple[int, int, int],
1292        position: tuple[int, int, int],
1293        px_size: float = 0.0076,
1294        layer_sizes: list[tuple[int, float]] = [(1, 0.01)],
1295    ):
1296        """
1297        Initialize a VariableLayerThicknessComponent.
1298
1299        Parameters:
1300        - size (tuple[int, int, int]): The size of the component in pixels/layers (width, height, depth).
1301        - position (tuple[int, int, int]): The position of the component in parent pixels/layers (x, y, z).
1302        - px_size (float): The pixel size in mm. Default is 0.0076.
1303        - layer_sizes (list[tuple[int, float]]): A list of layer sizes (as tuples) where each tuple contains the number of duplicates and its size in mm.
1304        """
1305        self._layer_sizes = layer_sizes
1306
1307        layer_count = sum(layer_size[0] for layer_size in layer_sizes)
1308
1309        if layer_count != size[2]:
1310            raise ValueError(
1311                f"Layers in layer sizes {layer_count} does not match component height {size[2]}"
1312            )
1313        layer_size = float_gcf([layer_size[1] for layer_size in layer_sizes])
1314        print(f"Using common denominator of {layer_size} for layer size for modeling.")
1315        print(
1316            "For best results, VariableLayerThicknessComponent height should align with parent component layers."
1317        )
1318        super().__init__(size, position, px_size, layer_size)
1319
1320    def _expand_layer_sizes(self) -> list[float]:
1321        """Expand the layer sizes into a list of heights for each layer."""
1322        expanded_sizes = []
1323        for count, size in self._layer_sizes:
1324            expanded_sizes.extend([size] * count)
1325        return expanded_sizes
1326
1327    def _get_device_height(self) -> float:
1328        """Get the height of the device in mm based on the layer sizes."""
1329        return sum(
1330            self._layer_sizes[i][0] * self._layer_sizes[i][1]
1331            for i in range(len(self._layer_sizes))
1332        )
1333
1334    def get_bounding_box(
1335        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
1336    ) -> tuple[int, int, int, int, int, int]:
1337        """
1338        Get the bounding box of the component.
1339        The bounding box is defined by the position and size of the component.
1340
1341        Parameters:
1342        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
1343        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
1344
1345        Returns:
1346        - A tuple of six integers representing the bounding box coordinates:
1347        """
1348        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
1349        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
1350
1351        min_x = self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
1352        max_x = (
1353            self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
1354            + self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
1355        )
1356        min_y = self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
1357        max_y = (
1358            self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
1359            + self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
1360        )
1361        min_z = self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
1362        max_z = (
1363            self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
1364            + self._get_device_height() / _layer_size
1365        )
1366        return (min_x, min_y, min_z, max_x, max_y, max_z)
1367
1368    def get_size(
1369        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
1370    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
1371        """
1372        Get the size of the component.
1373
1374        Parameters:
1375        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
1376        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
1377
1378        Returns:
1379        - A tuple of three integers representing the size of the component (width, height, depth).
1380        """
1381        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
1382        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
1383        return (
1384            self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size,
1385            self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size,
1386            self._get_device_height() / _layer_size,
1387        )
1388

class Port(_InstantiationTrackerMixin): 
 84class Port(_InstantiationTrackerMixin):
 85    """
 86    ###### Class representing a port in a microfluidic device.
 87    ###### Ports are used to connect components and define their interaction with the environment.
 88    ###### Each port has a type (IN, OUT, INOUT), a position in 3D space, a size, and a surface normal.
 89    ###### The surface normal defines the direction in which the port is oriented.
 90    """
 91
 92    class PortType(Enum):
 93        """Enumeration for port types."""
 94
 95        IN = 1
 96        OUT = 2
 97        INOUT = 3
 98
 99    class SurfaceNormal(Enum):
100        """Enumeration for surface normals."""
101
102        POS_X = 1
103        POS_Y = 2
104        POS_Z = 3
105        NEG_X = 4
106        NEG_Y = 5
107        NEG_Z = 6
108
109    _vector_map = {
110        SurfaceNormal.POS_X: (1, 0, 0),
111        SurfaceNormal.POS_Y: (0, 1, 0),
112        SurfaceNormal.POS_Z: (0, 0, 1),
113        SurfaceNormal.NEG_X: (-1, 0, 0),
114        SurfaceNormal.NEG_Y: (0, -1, 0),
115        SurfaceNormal.NEG_Z: (0, 0, -1),
116    }
117
118    def __init__(
119        self,
120        _type: PortType,
121        position: tuple[int, int, int],
122        size: tuple[int, int, int],
123        surface_normal: SurfaceNormal,
124    ):
125        """
126        ###### Initialize a port.
127
128        ###### Parameters:
129        - _type (PortType): The type of the port (IN, OUT, INOUT).
130        - position (tuple[int, int, int]): The position of the port in 3D space.
131        - size (tuple[int, int, int]): The size of the port.
132        - surface_normal (SurfaceNormal): The surface normal of the port, defining its orientation.
133        """
134        super().__init__()
135        self._parent = None
136        self._name = None
137        self._type = _type
138        self._position = position
139        self._size = size
140        self._surface_normal = surface_normal
141
142    def copy(self) -> "Port":
143        """Create a copy of the port."""
144        p = Port(
145            self._type,
146            self._position,
147            self._size,
148            self._surface_normal,
149        )
150        p._parent = self._parent
151        p._name = self._name
152        return p
153
154    def get_name(self) -> str:
155        """Get the name of the port, including parent name."""
156        if self._name is None:
157            raise ValueError(f"Port has not been named")
158        else:
159            return f"{self._parent._name}_{self._name}"
160
161    def get_fully_qualified_name(self) -> str:
162        """Get the fully qualified name of the port, including all parent components names."""
163        if self._name is None:
164            raise ValueError(f"Port has not been named")
165        name = self._name
166        parent = self._parent
167        while parent is not None:
168            if parent._name is not None:
169                name = f"{parent._name}.{name}"
170                parent = parent._parent
171            else:
172                name = f"{parent.instantiating_file_stem}.{name}"
173                return name
174        return name
175
176    def to_vector(self) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
177        """Convert the surface normal to a vector."""
178        try:
179            return self._vector_map[self._surface_normal]
180        except KeyError:
181            raise ValueError(f"Unsupported surface normal: {self._surface_normal}")
182
183    def get_bounding_box(
184        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
185    ) -> tuple[int, int, int, int, int, int]:
186        """
187        Get the bounding box of the port.
188        The bounding box is defined by the position and size of the port,
189        adjusted based on the surface normal direction.
190
191        Parameters:
192        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
193        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
194
195        Returns:
196        - A tuple of six integers representing the bounding box coordinates:
197        (min_x, min_y, min_z, max_x, max_y, max_z)
198        """
199        dx, dy, dz = self._vector_map[self._surface_normal]
200        pos = list(self._position)
201        size = self._size
202
203        # For negative directions, shift start back by size
204        if dx < 0:
205            pos[0] -= size[0]
206        if dy < 0:
207            pos[1] -= size[1]
208        if dz < 0:
209            pos[2] -= size[2]
210
211        _px_size = self._parent._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
212        _layer_size = self._parent._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
213
214        return (
215            pos[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
216            pos[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
217            pos[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
218            pos[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size
219            + size[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
220            pos[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size
221            + size[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
222            pos[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size
223            + size[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
224        )
225
226    def get_origin(self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None):
227        """
228        Get the origin of the port, which is the minimum corner of its bounding box.
229
230        Parameters:
231        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
232        """
233        return self.get_bounding_box(px_size, layer_size)[0:3]
234
235    def get_position(
236        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
237    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
238        """
239        Get the position of the port in 3D space.
240
241        Parameters:
242        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
243        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
244
245        Returns:
246        - A tuple of three integers representing the position of the port (x, y, z).
247        """
248
249        _px_size = self._parent._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
250        _layer_size = self._parent._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
251        return (
252            self._position[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
253            self._position[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
254            self._position[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
255        )
256
257    def get_size(
258        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
259    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
260        """
261        Get the size of the port.
262
263        Parameters:
264        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
265
266        Returns:
267        - A tuple of three integers representing the size of the port (width, height, depth).
268        """
269        _px_size = self._parent._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
270        _layer_size = self._parent._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
271        return (
272            self._size[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
273            self._size[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
274            self._size[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
275        )
276
277    def get_color(self):
278        """
279        ###### Get the color of the port based on its type.
280
281        ###### The color is determined as follows:
282        - IN ports are green
283        - OUT ports are red
284        - INOUT ports are blue
285        - If the type is not recognized, it defaults to white.
286
287        ###### Returns:
288        - Color: The color of the port.
289        """
290        if self._type == Port.PortType.IN:
291            return Color.from_name("green", 255)  # Green
292        elif self._type == Port.PortType.OUT:
293            return Color.from_name("red", 255)  # Red
294        elif self._type == Port.PortType.INOUT:
295            return Color.from_name("blue", 255)  # Blue
296        else:
297            return Color.from_name("white", 255)  # White

218            pos[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size
219            + size[0] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
220            pos[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size
221            + size[1] * self._parent._px_size / _px_size,
222            pos[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size
223            + size[2] * self._parent._layer_size / _layer_size,
224        )

Parameters:

  • px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
  • layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.

Returns:

  • A tuple of six integers representing the bounding box coordinates: (min_x, min_y, min_z, max_x, max_y, max_z)

def get_color(self): 
277    def get_color(self):
278        """
279        ###### Get the color of the port based on its type.
280
281        ###### The color is determined as follows:
282        - IN ports are green
283        - OUT ports are red
284        - INOUT ports are blue
285        - If the type is not recognized, it defaults to white.
286
287        ###### Returns:
288        - Color: The color of the port.
289        """
290        if self._type == Port.PortType.IN:
291            return Color.from_name("green", 255)  # Green
292        elif self._type == Port.PortType.OUT:
293            return Color.from_name("red", 255)  # Red
294        elif self._type == Port.PortType.INOUT:
295            return Color.from_name("blue", 255)  # Blue
296        else:
297            return Color.from_name("white", 255)  # White

class Component(_InstantiationTrackerMixin): 
 300class Component(_InstantiationTrackerMixin):
 301    """
 302    ###### Base class for components in a microfluidic device.
 303    ###### Components can contain shapes, ports, subcomponents, and labels.
 304    ###### Each component has a size, position, pixel size, and layer size.
 305    ###### Components can be translated, rotated, mirrored, and rendered.
 306    """
 307
 308    def __init__(
 309        self,
 310        size: tuple[int, int, int],
 311        position: tuple[int, int, int],
 312        px_size: float = 0.0076,
 313        layer_size: float = 0.01,
 314    ):
 315        """
 316        ###### Parameters:
 317        - size (tuple[int, int, int]): The size of the component in pixels (width, height, depth).
 318        - position (tuple[int, int, int]): The position of the component in 3D space (x, y, z).
 319        - px_size (float): The size of a pixel in mm. Default is 0.0076 m.
 320        - layer_size (float): The size of a layer in mm. Default is 0.01 m.
 321        """
 322        super().__init__()
 323        self._parent = None
 324        self._name = None
 325        self._position = position
 326        self._size = size
 327        self._px_size = px_size
 328        self._layer_size = layer_size
 329        self._translations = [0, 0, 0]
 330        self._rotation = 0
 331        self._mirroring = [False, False]
 332        self.shapes = {}
 333        self.bulk_shapes = {}
 334        self.ports = {}
 335        self.connected_ports = []
 336        self.subcomponents = {}
 337        self.default_exposure_settings = None
 338        self.default_position_settings = None
 339        self.regional_settings = {}
 340        self.burnin_settings = []
 341        self.labels = {}
 342
 343    def __eq__(self, other):
 344        """
 345        ###### Check if two components are equivilant based on their attribute.
 346        ###### We only need to compare the instantiated attributes, the rotation, and mirroring.
 347        """
 348        if not isinstance(other, Component):
 349            return False
 350        if not type(self) == type(other):
 351            return False
 352        if self._rotation != other._rotation:
 353            return False
 354        if self._mirroring != other._mirroring:
 355            return False
 356        if len(self.init_args) != len(other.init_args):
 357            return False
 358        for i, arg in enumerate(self.init_args):
 359            if arg != other.init_args[i]:
 360                return False
 361        if len(self.init_kwargs) != len(other.init_kwargs):
 362            return False
 363        for k, v in self.init_kwargs.items():
 364            if k not in other.init_kwargs or v != other.init_kwargs[k]:
 365                return False
 366        return True
 367
 368    def __getattr__(self, name):
 369        """
 370        ###### Custom attribute lookup for Component.
 371        ###### This method is called when an attribute is not found in the usual places.
 372        ###### It allows accessing ports by their names."""
 373        if name in self.ports:
 374            return self.ports[name]
 375        raise AttributeError(f"'{type(self).__name__}' object has no attribute '{name}'")
 376
 377    def get_fully_qualified_name(self):
 378        """Get the fully qualified name of the component, including all parent components names."""
 379        if self._name is None:
 380            raise ValueError(f"Component has not been named")
 381        name = self._name
 382        parent = self._parent
 383        while parent is not None:
 384            if parent._name is not None:
 385                name = f"{parent._name}.{name}"
 386                parent = parent._parent
 387            else:
 388                name = f"{parent.instantiating_file_stem}.{name}"
 389                return name
 390        return name
 391
 392    def get_bounding_box(
 393        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 394    ) -> tuple[int, int, int, int, int, int]:
 395        """
 396        Get the bounding box of the component.
 397        The bounding box is defined by the position and size of the component.
 398
 399        Parameters:
 400        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 401        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 402
 403        Returns:
 404        - A tuple of six integers representing the bounding box coordinates:
 405        """
 406        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 407        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 408
 409        # if self._rotation % 180 != 0:
 410        #     min_x = self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 411        #     max_x = (
 412        #         self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 413        #         + self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 414        #     )
 415        #     min_y = self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 416        #     max_y = (
 417        #         self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 418        #         + self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 419        #     )
 420        #     min_z = self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 421        #     max_z = (
 422        #         self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 423        #         + self._size[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 424        #     )
 425        # else:
 426        min_x = self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 427        max_x = (
 428            self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 429            + self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size
 430        )
 431        min_y = self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 432        max_y = (
 433            self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 434            + self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size
 435        )
 436        min_z = self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 437        max_z = (
 438            self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 439            + self._size[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size
 440        )
 441        return (min_x, min_y, min_z, max_x, max_y, max_z)
 442
 443    def get_size(
 444        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 445    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
 446        """
 447        Get the size of the component.
 448
 449        Parameters:
 450        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 451        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 452
 453        Returns:
 454        - A tuple of three integers representing the size of the component (width, height, depth).
 455        """
 456        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 457        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 458        return (
 459            self._size[0] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 460            self._size[1] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 461            self._size[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size,
 462        )
 463
 464    def get_position(
 465        self, px_size: float = None, layer_size: float = None
 466    ) -> tuple[int, int, int]:
 467        """
 468        Get the position of the component in 3D space.
 469
 470        Parameters:
 471        - px_size (float, optional): The pixel size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's pixel size.
 472        - layer_size (float, optional): The layer size in mm. If not provided, uses the component's layer size.
 473
 474        Returns:
 475        - A tuple of three integers representing the position of the component (x, y, z).
 476        """
 477        _px_size = self._px_size if px_size is None else px_size
 478        _layer_size = self._layer_size if layer_size is None else layer_size
 479        return (
 480            self._position[0] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 481            self._position[1] * self._px_size / _px_size,
 482            self._position[2] * self._layer_size / _layer_size,
 483        )

 485    def _validate_name(self, name):
 486        """
 487        ###### Validate the name for a new port.
 488        ###### Raises:
 489        - ValueError: If the name already exists in the component or is not a valid Python identifier.
 490        """
 491        for p in self.ports.keys():
 492            if p == name:
 493                raise ValueError(
 494                    f"Port with name '{name}' already exists in component {self._name}"
 495                )
 496        if not name.isidentifier():
 497            raise ValueError(
 498                f"Name '{name}' is not a valid Python identifier (e.g. no spaces, starts with letter, etc.)"
 499            )
 500        if hasattr(self, name):
 501            raise ValueError(f"Name '{name}' conflicts with existing attributes")
 502
 503    def add_label(self, name: str, color: Color):
 504        """
 505        ###### Add a label to the component.
 506        ###### Parameters:
 507        - name (str): The name of the label (must be a unique python identifier).
 508        - color (Color): The color of the label, which can be a Color object or a tuple of RGBA values.
 509        """
 510        self._validate_name(name)
 511        self.labels[name] = color
 512
 513    def add_shape(self, name: str, shape: Shape, label: str):
 514        """
 515        ###### Add a shape to the component.
 516        ###### Parameters:
 517        - name (str): The name of the shape (must be a unique python identifier).
 518        - shape (Shape): The shape to be added.
 519        - label (str): The label for the shape, which should be a key in the component's labels dictionary.
 520        """
 521        self._validate_name(name)
 522        shape._name = name
 523        shape._parent = self
 524        shape._color = self.labels[label]
 525        self.shapes[name] = shape

 553    def add_subcomponent(self, name: str, component: Component):
 554        """
 555        ###### Add a subcomponent to the component.
 556        ###### Parameters:
 557        - name (str): The name of the subcomponent (must be a unique python identifier).
 558        - component (Component): The subcomponent to be added.
 559        """
 560        self._validate_name(name)
 561        component._name = name
 562        component._parent = self
 563        component.run_translate()
 564        self.subcomponents[name] = component
 565
 566        for label, color in component.labels.items():
 567            self.labels[f"{name}.{label}"] = color

 591    def add_regional_settings(
 592        self,
 593        name: str,
 594        shape: Shape,
 595        settings: Union[
 596            PositionSettings,
 597            ExposureSettings,
 598            MembraneSettings,
 599            SecondaryDoseSettings,
 600        ],
 601        label: str,
 602    ):
 603        """
 604        ###### Add regional settings in a given shape to the component.
 605        ###### Parameters:
 606        - name (str): The name of the regional settings (must be a unique python identifier).
 607        - shape (Shape): The shape to which the regional settings apply.
 608        - settings (Union[PositionSettings, ExposureSettings, MembraneSettings, SecondaryDoseSettings]): The settings to be applied in the shape.
 609        - label (str): The label for the regional settings, which should be a key in the component's labels dictionary.
 610        """
 611        self._validate_name(name)
 612        shape._name = name
 613        shape._parent = self
 614        shape._color = self.labels[label]
 615
 616        # check for collisions with other settings
 617        for existing_name, (
 618            existing_shape,
 619            existing_settings,
 620        ) in self.regional_settings.items():
 621            if (
 622                type(settings) == type(existing_settings)
 623                and not (existing_shape.copy() & shape.copy())._object.is_empty()
 624            ):
 625                raise ValueError(
 626                    f"Regional settings '{name}' collides with existing settings '{existing_name}' in component {self._name}"
 627                )
 628
 629        self.regional_settings[name] = (shape, settings)
 630

 639    def relabel_subcomponents(self, subcomponents: list[Component], label: str):
 640        """
 641        ###### Relabel listed subcomponents with a new label.
 642        ###### Parameters:
 643        - subcomponents (list[Component]): List of subcomponents to relabel.
 644        - label (str): The new label to apply to the subcomponents.
 645        """
 646        for c in subcomponents:
 647            c.relabel_labels(c.labels.keys(), label, self.labels[label])
 648
 649    def relabel_labels(self, labels: list[str], label: str, _color: Color = None):
 650        """
 651        ###### Relabel subcomponent labels with a new label and color.
 652        ###### Parameters:
 653        - labels (list[str]): List of labels to relabel.
 654        - label (str): The new label to apply.
 655        - _color (Color, optional): The color to apply to the labels. If None, uses the color of the specified label. (internal use only)
 656        """
 657        if _color is None:
 658            _color = self.labels[label]
 659        for l, c in self.labels.items():
 660            if l in labels:
 661                c._change_to_color(_color)
 662        for c in self.subcomponents.values():
 663            c.relabel_labels(labels, label, _color)
 664
 665    def relabel_shapes(self, shapes: list[Shape], label: str):
 666        """
 667        ###### Relabel shapes with a new label.
 668        ###### Parameters:
 669        - shapes (list[Shape]): List of shapes to relabel.
 670        - label (str): The new label to apply to the shapes.
 671        """
 672        for s in shapes:
 673            s._color = self.labels[label]
